isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 3200, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 8500, 8600 - ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - IC BUS - CHASSIS ACCESSORIES - TROUBLESHOOTING

svcprocinfo.para: Before beginning these test procedures, do the following:

item.para: Make sure the vehicle batteries are at 75% state of charge (SOC) or higher. This represents an open circuit voltage (OCV) of 12.4 volts. Batteries with an OCV of 12 volts or less are either completely discharged or have a dead cell.
Check any light or indicator lamp filaments that are suspected of being open (burned out). This is done to avoid unnecessary extensive circuit checks.
Inspect all connectors for loose or damaged pins, wires, etc. Refer to TEST EQUIPMENT AND CONNECTOR REPAIR section in GROUP 08 - ELECTRICAL in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.

When the technician determines that a fuse is blown, while checking its condition, he is directed to locate the cause of the overload condition and to repair it. While no further instruction on this procedure is listed in the diagnostic tables, the common procedure is as follows: isolate sections of the circuit by disconnecting connectors, and measure the resistance to ground to find the circuit that is shorted to ground. Then locate the damaged spot in the wire or connector and repair.

Diagnostics for circuits that are malfunctioning by sticking in the ON position are generally not covered in detail. It is assumed that the technician knows to check for a malfunctioning switch, relay, or solenoid.

entry.para: Check fuse F22 for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
Move key switch to ignition position, disconnect connector (1141), and at fuse F22 and circuit 13K, measure voltage to ground. Reconnect connector (1141).
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 13K, then repair.
Remove air dryer/drain valve relay (1145). At relay socket, measure voltage from circuit 14L to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage condition in circuit 14L, conn. (1145), then repair.
At relay socket (1145), measure voltage from circuits 13K to 13-G.
Locate cause of low or no voltage condition in (1145), circuits 13K to 13-G, then repair.
Bench test air dryer/drain valve relay (1145), by measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87A.
Apply +12V to relay pin 86 and ground to pin 85. Measure resistance from pin 30 to 87.
Check in-line fuse (1146) for open condition, by measuring resistance from relay socket pin 87 to connector (1142) pin B.
Re-install relay (1145). Disconnect connector (1143), move key switch to ignition position, and at (1143) circuit 39A, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 13L, in-line fuse (1146), conn. (1143), circuit 39/39A, then repair.
Reconnect conn. (1143), and disconnect white wire at air dryer (78), move key switch to ignition position and at air dryer black wire connection, measure voltage to ground.
Air dryer black wire to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in black wire, then repair.
At air dryer (78), measure voltage from black wire to disconnected white wire.
Air dryer black wire to white.
Locate open or poor connection in white ground wire, then repair.
Measure resistance between ground and white wire of connector (78).
Locate open or poor connection in white wire, then repair.
Install a test jumper wire between the black wire and terminal A of air dryer connector (78). Turn key ON and measure voltage between terminal B of connector (78) and white wire.
Service thermal switch/heater assembly of air dryer.
Check fuse F22 for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
Move key switch to ignition position, disconnect connector (1141), and at fuse F22, circuit 13K, measure voltage to ground. Reconnect connector (1141).
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 13K, then repair.
Check in-line fuse (1146) for open condition, by measuring resistance from relay socket pin 87 to connector (1142) pin B.
Disconnect conn. (1142), move key switch to ignition position, and measure voltage at circuit 39 to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 39, then repair.
Reconnect conn. (1142), and disconnect drain valve conn. (1144). Move key switch to ignition position, and at black wire (coming from circuit 39B), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in black wire, then repair.
At disconnected drain valve conn. measure voltage from black feed wire to black air dryer wire with air dryer cooled to below 10°C (50°F).
Black feed wire to cool air dryer wire.
Drain valve circuits check good. If valve freezes up, repair or replace defective drain valve assembly.
Does the fuel filter restriction light work properly?
Does the water-in-fuel system operate properly?
Does the heated fuel filter work properly?
Remove fuel heater relay (1136). At relay socket, measure voltage from cont. 1, circuit 14K to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage condition in circuit 14K, 13F, 13J, conn. (1139), circuit 19, or open in-line fuse (1138), then repair.
At relay socket, measure voltage from cont. 5 circuit 13E to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage condition in circuit 13A, conn. (3), conn. (1139) circuit 13A, 13E or open fuse F22, then repair.
At relay socket (1136), measure voltage from cont. 2 circuit 13A-G to cont. 5 circuit 13E.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 13A-G, then repair.
Bench test fuel filter relay (1136) by measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87A.
Apply +12V to relay pin 86 and ground to pin 85. Measure resistance from pin 30 to 87.
Reconnect relay (1136) and disconnect circuit 19A from fuel filter. Turn key ON and measure voltage from circuit 19A to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage condition in circuit 19, 19A, in-line fuse (1138), conn. (401), (1139), then repair.
With the fuel heater cooled to below 10°C (50°F), measure voltage from circuit 19A to the heater power stud.
Fuel filter, 19A to heater power stud.
Heated fuel filter system checks good.
Repair or replace heated fuel filter.
Disconnect water-in-fuel module (470). Turn key ON and at connector, measure voltage from circuit 19A to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage condition in circuit 13A, conn. (3), cir. 13A, 19A or for open fuse F22, then repair.
At WIF socket (470), measure voltage across circuit 19A to 19C.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 19C, conn. (2), cir. 19C, conn. (1150) or key switch, then repair.
At WIF socket (470), install jumper from circuit 19A to 19B. Does warning light operate?
Disconnect WIF warning light conn. (433) and at circuit 19B, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage condition in circuit 19B, then repair.
At WIF light connector (433), measure voltage across circuit 19B to 19-G.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 19-G, then repair.
At WIF module connector (470) move jumper across circuit 19A to 19E. At the fuel filter, disconnect circuit 19E from the water probe. Turn key ON and measure voltage from circuit 19E to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage condition in circuit 19E, or fuel filter conn. (401), then repair.
Remove jumper and reconnect WIF module (470). At water probe conn., jumper circuit 19E to ground. Does light work?
Water probe conn., jumper 19E to gnd.
Remove water probe and install jumper from the probe to ground. Measure voltage from circuit 19E to water probe feed stud.
Water probe, 19E to probe feed stud.
Install probe and conn. WIF system checks good.
Remove filter light conn. (434) and measure voltage from circuit 19F to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 19F, conn. (1150), cir. 19F, 28, or open fuse F24, then repair.
Reconnect light conn. (434) and disconnect fuel filter switch conn. (N/L). Measure voltage from circuit 19D to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 19D, conn. (1150), dash conn. (2), cir 19D or fuel filter conn. (401), then repair.
Fuel filter restriction light circuitry checks good. If condition persists, replace fuel filter switch.
Check fuse F22 for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then correct. Replace fuse.
Remove fuel heater/AT transmission relay (1136). At relay socket, measure voltage from circuit 14K to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage condition in circuit 14K, relay (1136), then repair.
At relay socket (1136), measure voltage from circuits 13E to 13A-G.
Locate cause of low or no voltage condition in (1136), circuits 13E to 13A-G, then repair.
Bench test fuel heater/AT transmission relay (1136), by measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87A.
Apply +12V to relay pin 86 and ground to pin 85. Measure resistance from pin 30 to 87.
Check in-line fuse (1137) for open condition, by measuring resistance from relay socket (1136) pin 87 to relay socket (403) pin 85.
Re-install relay (1136). Remove modulator solenoid relay from socket (403). Turn key switch ON and measure voltage from circuit 92D and then 92B to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 13, 92, in-line fuse (1137), circuit 92A, 92D, relay conn. (403), then repair.
At socket (403), measure voltage from circuit 92B to 92C.
Bench test modulator sol. relay by verifying that contacts at pin 30 and 87 are closed when de-energized and open when relay is energized. Does relay test good?
With key OFF, disconnect ECM conn. (379) and install a jumper from circuit 92E to ground. At (403) measure resistance from circuit 92E to ground.
Remove jumper and refer to Engine Diagnostic Manual.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 92E, conn. (403), or conn. (1140), then repair. Remove jumper and reconnect connectors.
Re-install modulator solenoid relay (403), and disconnect modulator shift solenoid conn. (404). Turn key ON and measure voltage from circuit 92C to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 92C or conn. (389), then repair.
At (404), measure voltage from circuit 92C to 92-G.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 92-G, conn. (389), or circuit 92-G/ 11-GJ, then repair.
Reconnect modulator sol. at (404) and listen for it to shift. Did it click? Reconnect ECM connector (379).
Allison automatic trans. circuits check good.
Check fuse F18 for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then correct. Replace fuse.
At F18, measure voltage from circuit 13 to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 13, then repair.
With key OFF, disconnect engine harness from bus cab dash conn. (2). Turn key ON and at conn. (2), measure voltage from circuit 97P to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 97P, then repair.
Install jumper wire to circuit 97P between conn. (2) and 97AU. At (2), with transmission in neutral and key switch ON, measure voltage from circuit 97AU to ground.
Disconnect neutral position switch in-line connector and measure voltage from circuit 97P to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 97P, then repair.
With transmission in neutral position, measure resistance of neutral position switch in-line connector.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in cir. 97AU, then repair.
Reconnect conn. (2) and remove crank relay (R5). Turn key ON and at (R5) circuit 97L, measure voltage to ground.
Allison automatic trans. neutral circuits check good. Go to next step.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 97AU, conn. (386), or circuit 97L, then repair.
Refer to Starting Motor System for further troubleshooting.

note.para: For troubleshooting brake switch circuit input signals to the engine ECM, refer to the Engine Diagnostic Manual.

entry.para: Remove hydraulic brake relay (300) and measure voltage from circuit 90A to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 90-FL/90/90A, then repair.
Disconnect circuit 90N from reserve pump motor. Install a jumper wire at relay socket (300) from circuit 90A to 90N. At reserve pump motor circuit 90N, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 90N, then repair.
Touch circuit 90N to reserve pump motor terminal. Does motor run?
Remove jumper, reconnect 90N. Go to next step.
Remove fuse F26 and check for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
At fuse F26 circuit 90B, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 90B or dash conn. (3), then repair.
Re-install fuse F26. Disconnect brake switch conn. (50). At (50) measure voltage from circuit 90C to ground, and circuit 70 to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuits 90C and 70, then repair.
Measure resistance across switch (50) contacts 3 and 4, 1 and 2 while brake pedal is depressed.
Reconnect conn. (50) and disconnect diode assembly from conn. (47). At (47) and with brake pedal depressed, measure voltage from circuit 90D to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 90D, then repair.
Disconnect brake monitor module conn. (49), and with brake pedal depressed, measure voltage from 90E to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 90E, then repair.
Check fuse F19 for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
Move key switch to ignition position and at F19, measure voltage from circuit 13 to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 13, then repair.
At disconnected conn. (47), measure voltage from circuit 90U to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 90U or 13B, then repair.
With multimeter in diode test mode, test diode assembly. Do diodes test good?
Reconnect diode assembly (47) and disconnect brake relay (300). Turn key ON and at socket (300), circuit 90H, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 90H or dash conn. (3), then repair.
Disconnect flow switch conn. and measure resistance across switch.
At flow switch conn., measure resistance of circuit 90-G to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 90-G/ 11-GJ, then repair.
Reconnect flow switch conn. and disconnect differential pressure switch conn. (301). At (301) circuit 90L, measure resistance to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 90L/90R, then repair.
At relay socket (300) circuit 90J, measure resistance to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in cir. 90J/90K, then repair.
Bench test hydraulic brake relay (300) by measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87A.
Bench test hydraulic brake relay (300) by applying +12V to pin 85 and ground to pin 86, and measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87.
At brake monitor module conn. (49), measure resistance from circuit 90M to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 90M or dash conn. (3), then repair.
Re-install brake relay (300). Turn key switch ON and depress brake pedal. At conn. (49) circuit 90F, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 90F, then repair.
With brake pedal depressed at conn. (49), measure voltage from circuit 90F to 90-G.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 90-G/11-G, then repair.
At conn. (49) and circuit 90R, measure voltage to ground while an assistant depresses brake pedal.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 90R/70C, then repair.
With brake pedal depressed and at conn. (49), measure voltage from circuit 90P to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 90P, then repair.
Reconnect conn. (49) and move key switch to ignition position. Do alarm and brake warning light operate?
Hydraulic brake system circuits check good.
Check bulb, buzzer, and parallel circuits 90S and 90T, then replace or repair problem.
If condition persists, refer to CTS-5280 Hydro-Max II Brake Monitor System.
